title: ESSENTIALS IN FINANCE
description:
Financial understanding and planning can make or break a business. So it’s vital you know how to read and understand your company’s numbers yourself – even if you work in a function like marketing, legal or HR.

This 100% online, self-paced programme explores key financial concepts over four modules. You dive into the numbers with a learning simulation – and get the knowledge you need to make informed business decisions.

sections.heading: EXPLORE KEY FINANCE CONCEPTS AND LEARN TO APPLY THEM
sections.content:
ESSENTIALS IN FINANCE

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Finance and accounting simulation
sections.content:
This programme is divided into eight modules, each focusing on a different aspect of financial management.  

Module 1: Finance and accounting simulation  
Discover how traditional business activities, financial transactions and financial statements relate to each other 
Understand cash flow statements, profit-and-loss accounts and balance sheets 
Learn how to calculate a number of key ratios 
Module 2 - 4: Financial statements
The balance sheet
The income statement
The cash flow statement
Module 5: What financial statements reveal
Learn how to asses a company’s liquidity, profitability and solvency
Module 6: Working capital management
Explore how managing working capital keeps organisations running smoothly
Module 7: Working capital optimisation
Learn how to optimise a company's cash position through managing inventory levels and accounts receivable and payable
Module 8: Wrap-up
Evaluate what you've learned throughout the programme
Plan how you will use your new knowledge and skills starting today

This online journey brings together learning formats including videos, simulations, exercises, quizzes, case studies and real-life examples. You’ll also have background reading to do and questions to help you reflect on your own experience. 
 
In addition, you’ll have the opportunity to put theory into practice and become confident at making financial decisions. By the end of the programme, you’ll be ready to leap into finance discussions and projects in your organisation. 
 
You can start Essentials in Finance at any time – and study wherever and whenever suits you. It takes around 10 to 12 hours to complete the programme and you can split this time over a maximum of three months.
